Key Arguments: Free speech is paramount and the best tool to counter misinformation.
Censorship could restrict the pursuit of truth and protect misinformation from critique.
Entities determining truth can be wrong, even with good intentions.
Government and professional news are excluded from misinformation suppression, suggesting bias.
The bill could have a chilling effect on speech as platforms may over-police content to avoid fines.
Main Themes: Critique of government and media exemption
Notable Quotes: Free speech IS itself the best tool to counter misinformation.
Censorship of alleged misinfo could actually restrict the pursuit of truth.
The fact that government messaging and 'professional news' output are excluded... suggests that the government is fine with misinformation as long as it comes from the right sources.
